title: FPS drops from 120-0 lasting 2-3s
body:
Mennekeies
Jul 25, 10:55 PDT

I went from Windows 8.1 to Windows 10 yesterday. I upgraded all drivers appropriately and I reinstalled LoL.

Issues: 
-loading into the game takes longer than before;
-while in-game, I experience massive FPS drops. From 120 to 0, lasting 2 to 3 seconds. These framedrops occur when I move stuff around in my inventory, when I press  to look at the champions in-game, when I access the store, when I access the menu, when I unlock my in-game camera and go through the map, when I change my camera position through the minimap, when a big ability happens. 
-when tabbing out of the game, my entire monitor turns black except for the taskbar in the bottom. When I  to get into task manager, the monitor works and allows me to choose between task manager, logging off, rebooting etc. but when I select task manager, it goes back to black, with the task manager shown in the taskbar. When tabbing around, nothing works. When clicking the X to close LoL, it doesn't work. When going back into the game, the entire monitor goes black.

All settings are on low. It doesn't change a thing, since the game runs normally on 120fps until I do one of the things that causes the drop. I also tried capping it on different fps, which doesn't make a difference either. In its current state, the game is 100% unplayable. I hope you can help me.


Also, some error lines out of the R3D log in case it helps.
000000.632|  ERROR| Riot::RADS::IO::OpenFile: RADS cannot open file "Global/Champions/champions.bin" because it's not in the manifest.
000000.633|  ERROR| Riot::RADS::IO::OpenFile: RADS cannot open file "Global/Loadouts/SummonerBadges.bin" because it's not in the manifest.

000001.082|  ERROR| Riot::RADS::IO::OpenFile: RADS cannot open file "C:/Riot Games/League of Legends/RADS/solutions/lol_game_client_sln/releases/0.0.1.138/deploy/Data/Menu/IMEConfig.xml" because it's not in the manifest.
000001.082|  ERROR| Missing file on r3dGFile open :C:/Riot Games/League of Legends/RADS/solutions/lol_game_client_sln/releases/0.0.1.138/deploy/Data/Menu/IMEConfig.xml
000001.082|  ERROR| Riot::RADS::IO::OpenFile: RADS cannot open file "\Bin\Data\C:/Riot Games/League of Legends/RADS/solutions/lol_game_client_sln/releases/0.0.1.138/deploy/Data/Menu/IMEConfig.xml" because it's not in the manifest.
000001.082|  ERROR| Missing file on r3dGFile open :\Bin\Data\C:/Riot Games/League of Legends/RADS/solutions/lol_game_client_sln/releases/0.0.1.138/deploy/Data/Menu/IMEConfig.xml

000012.165|  ERROR| Cant load particle system AnnieBasicAttack_mis.troy
000012.165|  ERROR| Failed to preload particle system "AnnieBasicAttack_mis.troy"
000012.166|  ERROR| Cant load particle system AnnieBasicAttack_mis.troy
000012.166|  ERROR| Failed to preload particle system "AnnieBasicAttack_mis.troy"
**(there was no Annie in-game)**

000012.773|  ERROR| Data Error on expression: always
 Data Error message: Missing effect texture

 Data Error message: Missing effect texture 

000013.254|  ERROR| Can not open file  *********

000013.258|   WARN| r3dTexture EX: TemplateFighterPassive.dds - not found. Dummy texture created.



The remaining 95% of the R3D file are the same errors as above.

replies.body:
Between the RADS errors and line breaks in your r3d log, it appears this issue may be influenced by League not having the right permissions to run. When League is missing crucial system permissions to access files and software packages outside of League that it relies on, it can run poorly or even crash. For the most common solutions to this issue, check out our [permissions guide.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions)

Let me know if you still have issues after working through the permissions guide.
